overview.problemStatement:
Forum

Is it true that\[\mathrm{ex}(n; K_{r,r}) \gg n^{2-1/r}?\]



K\"{o}v\'{a}ri, S\'{o}s, and Tur\'{a}n \cite{KST54} proved\[\mathrm{ex}(n; K_{r,r}) \ll n^{2-1/r}\]for all $r\geq 2$. Brown \cite{Br66} and, independently, Erd\H{o}s, R\'{e}nyi, and S\'{o}s \cite{ERS66}, proved the conjectured lower bound when $r=3$.

When $r=2$ it is known that\[\mathrm{ex}(n;K_{2,2})=\left(\frac{1}{2}+o(1)\right)n^{3/2}\](see [768], since $K_{2,2}=C_4$).

See also [147].




References


[Br66] Brown, W. G., On graphs that do not contain a Thomsen graph. Canad. Math. Bull. (1966), 281-285.

[ERS66] Erd\H{o}s, P. and R\'{e}nyi, A. and S\'os, V. T., On a problem of graph theory. Studia Sci. Math. Hungar. (1966), 215--235.

[KST54] K\"{o}vari, T. and S\'{o}s, V. T. and Tur\'{a}n, P., On a problem of K. Zarankiewicz. Colloq. Math. (1954), 50-57.
